page.title: 09Recreation & Entertainment
page.content: Though a small village Hundon has numerouis recreational activities organised for all ages from "toddlers" to the elderly. The main centre for these activities is the Village Hall which was built shortly after the second world war with money donated or raised locally. The building was erected by work parties of young people from abroad under the supervision of Mr. Russel Howes of Mount Pleasant. There are three fields for outdoor activities. One is administered by the Parish Council and the other by the Hundon Foundation Trust. The third field is owned by Suffolk Education Authority for the erection of a replacement school for the village though it looks unlikely that the school will ever be erected.
